item.title: Endpoints
item.description: EndpointsTo invoke a Cloudflare Firewall Rules API operation, append the endpoint to the Cloudflare API base URL: https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/ For authentication instructions, refer to Getting Started: Requests in the Cloudflare API documentation. For help with endpoints and pagination, refer to Getting Started: Endpoints. The Firewall Rules API endpoints require a value for <ZONE_ID>. To retrieve a list of zones associated with your account, use the List Zones operation and note the zone ID associated with the domain whose firewall rules you want to manage.

item.title: POST example
item.description: POST exampleThis example creates several firewall rules using a single API call. To create a firewall rule you need a filter identifier (id). If you have not created a filter yet, refer to the Cloudflare Filters API documentation. --- header: Request --- curl -X POST \ "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/zones/<ZONE_ID>/firewall/rules" \ -H "X-Auth-Email: <EMAIL>" \ -H "X-Auth-Key: <API_KEY>" \ -H "Content-Type: application/json" \ -d '[ { "filter": { "id": "<FILTER_ID_1>" }, "action": "allow", "description": "Do not challenge login from office" }, { "filter": { "id": "<FILTER_ID_2>" }, "action": "challenge", "description": "Challenge login" }, { "filter": { "id": "<FILTER_ID_3>" }, "action": "js_challenge", "description": "JS challenge site" }, { "filter": { "id": "<FILTER_ID_4>" }, "action": "allow", "description": "Allow API traffic without challenge" } ]' --- header: Response --- { "result": [ { "id": "<RULE_ID_1>", "paused": false, "description": "Do not challenge login from office", "action": "allow", "priority": null, "filter": { "id": "<FILTER_ID_1>", "expression": "ip.

item.title: GET examples
item.description: GET examples ​​ Get all rules This example returns all the firewall rules in the zone with ID <ZONE_ID>. --- header: Request --- curl -X GET \ "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/zones/<ZONE_ID>/firewall/rules" \ -H "X-Auth-Email: <EMAIL>" \ -H "X-Auth-Key: <API_KEY>" --- header: Response --- { "result": [ { "id": "<RULE_ID_1>", "paused": false, "description": "allow API traffic without challenge", "action": "allow", "priority": null, "filter": { "id": "<FILTER_ID_1>", "expression": "http.request.uri.path matches \"^/api/.*$\"", "paused": false, "description": "/api" } }, { "id": "<RULE_ID_2>", "paused": false, "description": "do not challenge login from office", "action": "allow", "priority": null, "filter": { "id": "<FILTER_ID_2>", "expression": "ip.

item.title: PUT examples
item.description: PUT examples ​​ Update multiple rules This example updates several firewall rules using a single API call. You can include up to 25 rules in the JSON object array (-d flag) to update as a batch. The batch is handled as a transaction. --- header: Request --- curl -X PUT \ "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/zones/<ZONE_ID>/firewall/rules" \ -H "X-Auth-Email: <EMAIL>" \ -H "X-Auth-Key: <API_KEY>" \ -H "Content-Type: application/json" \ -d '[ { "id": "<RULE_ID>", "paused": false, "description": "Challenge site", "action": "challenge", "priority": null, "filter": { "id": "<FILTER_ID>", "expression": "not http.

item.title: DELETE examples
item.description: DELETE examples NoteThe DELETE operation does not delete any filter related to the firewall rule. To delete the filter, use the Filters API. ​​ Delete multiple rules This example deletes firewall rules with IDs <RULE_ID_1> and <RULE_ID_2>. --- header: Request --- curl -X DELETE \ "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/zones/<ZONE_ID>/firewall/rules?id=<RULE_ID_1>&id=<RULE_ID_2>" \ -H "X-Auth-Email: <EMAIL>" \ -H "X-Auth-Key: <API_KEY>" --- header: Response --- { "result": [ { "id": "<RULE_ID_1>" }, { "id": "<RULE_ID_2>" } ], "success": true, "errors": [], "messages": [] } ​​ Delete a single rule This example deletes the rule with ID <RULE_ID>.
